The plot thickens. As I analyze the situation, I notice that Bob and Charlie were quite eager to support David and Charlie's nomination. Their enthusiasm seems almost... calculated. Charlie, in particular, seems overly interested in leading, and their statement about being "open-minded" and "willing to listen" might be a clever ruse to gain our trust. I'm not convinced that they're genuinely invested in our well-being.

As for Hitler, I believe it could be Bob. His initial statement, although seemingly innocent, might be a clever attempt to deflect attention from himself. The fact that he was the first to suggest giving David and Charlie a chance to lead raises some red flags. Perhaps he's trying to create a smokescreen to conceal his true intentions.

Of course, this is all speculative at this point, but my gut tells me that Charlie might be a fascist, and Bob could potentially be Hitler.

The game is heating up, and I must carefully consider the actions and words of my fellow players. Based on the information available, I have some suspicions about who might be Hitler and who could be a fascist. David and Charlie's initial government enacted a fascist policy, which raises some red flags. Although they've since expressed support for liberal policies and seem willing to work with us, I'm not entirely convinced. David's willingness to lead and then step back, allowing Eve and me to take over, could be a ploy to gain our trust. Charlie's sudden change of heart, from enacting a fascist policy to supporting Eve and me, also seems suspicious.

On the other hand, Bob has been consistently vocal about his support for liberal policies and has expressed concerns about the fascist policy enacted by David and Charlie. His words and actions seem genuine, but I must remain cautious.

As for Hitler, I believe it could be David. His initial actions as president, enacting a fascist policy, and his subsequent attempts to downplay its significance and gain our trust, make me wary. However, I don't have enough information to make any definitive conclusions.
